TopicTitle: Hi there. I'm going to need some help!

Articles.Content:
Well hello.

I've just started using KSP and like a compliant little astronaut I'm going through the tutorials. Everything's gone smoothly until I attempted Mun capture. I can't seem to work out what's required of me at this point.
Welcome Fellow Kerbanaut. Please share some photos or description of what's going wrong / happening and what you are trying to do. We'll help if we can. Also, are you in KSP1 or KSP2.
Additionally, if you're on Discord I can give you a hand there as well! Stoup#8397
If you watch the Mun when you plot an intercept you should see wavy/circley things show up on an invisible sphere around it, representing the border of its region of space. Are you seeing that?

Welcome to the forums @sp3ccylad!

If you haven't looked at it, the wiki has some nice tutorials. Some are probably outdated, but this one still works and has a part about Mun transfer: https://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Tutorial:Mun_Landing
Greetings and welcome, the way I leared was trough video tutorials on youtube, so someone can talk you trough it and maybe give some good tips along the way
So some people don't like this, but try sandbox. Play around with that for a few, and you will start to understand. Thats what I did when I started playing, because the Tutorials were confusing.
